sen.j: 訓読すれば「餓鬼に施す」と読めることからも分かるように、六道輪廻の世界にある凡夫の中でも、死後に特に餓鬼道に堕ちた衆生のために食べ物を布施し、その霊を供養する儀礼を指す。
sen.e: As it can be read as 'feeding hungry ghosts' in the "kun" or Japanese reading, it means the rites to feed living things who fell into Gaki-do specially after their death among Bompu (unenlightened persons) in the worlds of Rokudo rinne (Rebirth in the Six Worlds) and holding a mass for their spirits.

sen.e: In Soto sect, it is commonly called Urabon-e Segaki, but the title of 'Segaki-e' was changed to 'Sejiki-e' because the high or the low and lord or loon should not been distinguished between the people who feed and those who are fed.
